#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Find the Hercules Constellation
#Text=The Hercules constellation is a cluster of stars resembling
#Text=Hercules , creating a torso with arms and legs in the night sky .
#Text=It 's easiest to spot the constellation from the Northern Hemisphere , but parts of the Southern Hemisphere can also see Hercules .
#Text=Try to find a square of bright stars called the Keystone that make up the body of the constellation .
#Text=If you need help finding it , pull up a picture of the Hercules constellation , download an app , or use a telescope for a magnified look at the stars .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Spotting Specific Star Clusters
#Text=Locate the stars Arcturus and Vega that are close to Hercules .
#Text=Arcturus can be found by looking southwest in the sky , while Vega can be spotted by looking east .
#Text=These two stars are known as being some of the brightest , making them noticeable with the naked eye .
#Text=You can use a star map to help you locate these two stars , if necessary .
#Text=The Hercules constellation is between Arcturus and Vega .
#Text=Spot neighboring constellations near the Hercules constellation .

#Text=For example , constellations like Aquila ( located southwest of Hercules ) , Corona Borealis ( to the east ) , Draco ( to the north ) , and Lyra ( to the west ) are all near the Hercules constellation .
#Text=If you 're able to locate any of these , it will help lead you to Hercules .
#Text=Other constellations near Hercules are Sagitta and Ophiuchus .
#Text=Look for the Keystone to help you spot the Hercules Constellation .
#Text=The Keystone is a set of 4 stars in the shape of a square .
#Text=The square of stars is tilted on its side similar to a diamond so that it resembles a torso .
#Text=The Keystone is made up of the stars Eta , Pi , Epsilon , and Zeta Herculis .
#Text=The Keystone stars are bright , making them easier to spot with the naked eye .
#Text=Try to find 2 legs and arms coming from the Keystone .
#Text=Once you ’ve located the Keystone , try to spot the 2 legs coming from the widest section of the Keystone , appearing as if they ’re running .
#Text=You ’ll also be able to see 2 arms that are stretched above the torso .
#Text=The arms and legs will be made up of stars strung along in relatively straight lines .
#Text=The legs of Hercules are made up of at least 4 stars , with 2 being at the knees of Hercules and the others where his feet would be .
#Text=The string of stars that make up the right arm is longer than those that make up the left .
#Text=Finding the Right Time and Location
#Text=Spot the Hercules constellation from April to November in the Northern Hemisphere .
#Text=The Hercules constellation is easiest to spot in the summer months of the Northern Hemisphere , and it is visible for half the year in this portion of the world .
#Text=While the constellation can be seen from most spots in the Southern Hemisphere , it ’s easiest to see it if you ’re in the Northern Hemisphere looking at the eastern sky .
#Text=Look for the constellation from June to September if you 're in the Southern Hemisphere .
#Text=The Hercules constellation is a bit harder to spot from the Southern Hemisphere , with your best chance being to look for it during July when it 's at its brightest .
#Text=Areas that are farthest south , such as Antarctica , wo n’t be able to see the Hercules constellation .
#Text=Go outside around 10 pm for the best view .
#Text=You ’ll need to wait until the evening or night to spot the stars so that they ’re well lit .
#Text=Go outdoors once it reaches 9 pm or later and look for a spot with lots of open sky , making it easier to see all of the stars at once .
#Text=Making the Process Easier
#Text=Consult a map or picture of the Hercules constellation for help .
#Text=If you would like to know what the Hercules constellation looks like so that you can find it more easily , go online to pull up a picture of it .
#Text=You can pull up the picture on your phone to bring with you easily outside , or you can print one out .
#Text=Type “ Hercules constellation ” into a search engine and click on images to find a reference picture to help you .
#Text=Use a telescope to make spotting the stars easier .
#Text=If you have access to a telescope to help you see the stars , this is a great way to find the Hercules constellation .
#Text=Look for the 4 bright stars with arms and legs coming from them and scan the sky slowly so that you make sure you do n’t miss them .
#Text=You can purchase a telescope from a technology store , as well as online .
#Text=Download a star-finding app to help you locate the constellation .
#Text=There are lots of apps that you can download and use on your phone that will show you a map of the sky and assist you in locating certain constellations .
#Text=Browse the star apps and download one that you think might help .
#Text=Apps like Pocket Universe , Star Walk , Star Chart , and Sky Map are all great resources for finding stars .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The constellation is in the third quadrant in the sky at latitudes between +90 degrees and -50 degrees .
